node.title: Botswanaâ€™s leader says foreign diplomats who traveled from Europe were among the first known Omicron cases.
node.alt: President Mokgweetsi Masisi of Botswana and his wife, Neo Masisi, arrive for a dinner at the presidential palace in Paris, in November.
node.description: Botswana and South Africa were the first countries to identify cases involving the Omicron variant.
node.content: ["Some of the first cases of the Omicron variant of the coronavirus to be detected in Botswana \u2014 which were among the first known in the world \u2014 were in foreign diplomats who had traveled to the country from Europe, the country\u2019s president said.", "President Mokgweetsi Masisi told CNN on Thursday that four diplomats who tested positive for the coronavirus on Nov. 11, and who were later found to be carrying the new variant, \u201ccame from a number of countries.\u201d He added: \u201cYes, some had been to Europe, and some had been elsewhere.\u201d He did not offer more details.", "Until now, Botswana had not disclosed the nationalities or other details of the four diplomats, with officials saying that they wanted to avoid stigmatizing other nations. The president\u2019s comments highlight that scientists still cannot say with certainty where the variant originated.", "Last week, after Botswana and South Africa became the first countries to identify the variant, many Western nations, including the United States, closed their borders to travelers from southern Africa. It was sometimes called the \u201cBotswana variant,\u201d before the World Health Organization last Friday labeled it a \u201cvariant of concern\u201d and named it Omicron.", "Mr. Masisi described the travel bans as \u201cirresponsible,\u201d saying that those nations were experiencing far worse coronavirus outbreaks than Botswana. With Omicron infections now detected in more than 40 countries, he added, Western nations could not say for certain how many cases of the variant were already \u201cin your own backyard.\u201d", "Instead, he said, rich countries should have focused on ensuring a more equitable distribution of Covid vaccines, particularly to Africa, which has the lowest vaccination rate of any continent.", "\u201cWhy does it take this to drive the point home, that no one is safe until we are all availed the vaccines?\u201d he said.", "In an earlier statement, the government said that scientists in Botswana had detected the new variant after testing four diplomats who entered the country on Nov. 7. They tested positive for the coronavirus on Nov. 11, and genetic sequencing confirmed on Nov. 24 that they were carrying the variant. ", "By then, officials have said, the diplomats had returned to their home countries."]
